data.title: Substring by coordinates
data.statement:
You are given two sets of coordinates, [[X1]] [[Y1]] and [[X2]] [[Y2]], followed by a block of text [[N]] lines long with varying lengths of characters.

Output the substring starting from [[X1]] [[Y1]] and ending at [[X2]] [[Y2]].
Where the first character of the first line is X: 0, Y: 0. 
The X value increases by {{1}} per character along a line, the Y value increases by {{1}} per line of text.

data.stubGenerator:
read X1:int Y1:int
read X2:int Y2:int
read N:int
loop N read ROW:string(1024)
write substring
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Two integers, [[X1]] [[Y1]], the starting coordinates of the substring
<<Line 2:>> Two integers, [[X2]] [[Y2]], the ending coordinates for the substring
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[N]], representing the number of lines of text to follow
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> The text to search as strings
data.outputDescription:
A substring from the text which started at coordinates [[X1]] [[Y1]] and finished at [[X2]] [[Y2]]
Do not include newline characters or whitespace.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given two sets of coordinates, X1 Y1 and X2 Y2, followed by a block of text N lines long with varying lengths of characters.

Output the substring starting from X1 Y1 and ending at X2 Y2.
Where the first character of the first line is X: 0, Y: 0.
The X value increases by 1 per character along a line, the Y value increases by 1 per line of text.
Input
Line 1: Two integers, X1 Y1, the starting coordinates of the substring
Line 2: Two integers, X2 Y2, the ending coordinates for the substring
Line 3: An integer N, representing the number of lines of text to follow
Next N lines: The text to search as strings
Output
A substring from the text which started at coordinates X1 Y1 and finished at X2 Y2
Do not include newline characters or whitespace.
Constraints
0 ≤ X1,Y1 ≤ X2,Y2 ≤ 50
0 ≤ N ≤ 50
Example
Input
0 0
3 0
5
[*{=U
*MRwV-3}K;
v#_=V&
GL3.;eMT_M
N4$X#4JhZz?
Output
[*{=
